âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear enough, and simple enough, provided you don't go too complex from the start.
The "reverse" mode should probably be disabled here?
Validator 6 failed where "CLASSIC PUZZLE - VERY HARD", the corresponding test, passed, because I forgot to replace "_" by " " in the difficulty before matching. This should probably be fixed :)

Goal
* First sentence: Suggest to change "page" to "statement".

* Suggest to enclose _ and / in brackets instead of quotation marks, i.e. ({{_}}) and ({{/}}).

* Above the example: Please delete the extra "<<" after "you must output".

* Example: Please add "[[puzzle_info]]:" above "Line1: Mars_Lander Easy Conditions".

* Example: Please delete "(Case-sensitive)" (if you want to mention that the search should be case-sensitive, mention it as part of the rules, instead of as part of the example).

* Background: @strong@: Did you intend to format that part in <<bold>>?

Input
* Please change "[[n]] Lines" to "Next [[n]] Lines".

* Please change "[[name]] [[difficulty]] [[tags]]" to "[[name]], [[difficulty]] and [[tags]]" and remove the quotation marks.

Cases
* Tests 5-7 & Validator 5-7: Please delete "Â®" in all input and output.

* Why are "CodinGame" and "Nintendo" not in all caps while other puzzle names are?

* Test 6 & Validator 6: Please change the [[keyword]] to one of the [[difficulty]] (preferably "Very_hard" for the validator so that there's a validator where the keyword contains an underscore, similar to Test 4).

* Please add a pair of cases where [[keyword]] is MARS_LANDER / POWER_OF_THOR for test/validator.

* Please add a pair of cases where [[keyword]] is TAN / WAR for test/validator.

* Please add a pair of cases where [[keyword]] is part of [[name]] and [[keyword]] contains a digit.

* Please add a pair of cases where [[keyword]] contains digit characters but not matching any puzzle, e.g. EPISODE_23, EPISODE_31.

Thanks.

Hello, @5DN1L, thanks for commenting.

I have fixed all the errors you have raised (except for the one at the bottom of my comment) and added the test-cases you specified as well as adding ~3 more.

I have formatted the statement and descriptions according to your instructions.

As to why the "SPONSORED PUZZLES" test-case uses names with one capital and many lowercase letters, there is 1 main reason for this:
1. I have searched CodinGame's puzzle "catalog", and typed the very labels of each puzzle.

Since the other official puzzles were labeled in all-caps, I thought it would be best to keep the test-cases as close as possible to the real puzzles labels. I hope this helps.

Do you have any other advice or improvements?

Thanks,
Code-Parser
Do you mean I should state that this must be done?

I state that the validator has a case it validates that a test does not on a honest code. I forgot to copy the code at the time unfortunately, but either the test should have failed, or the validator should have passed with my mistake, however here, the test suceeded and the validator failed :)

Hmm... interesting.

I'll take a look at it. Validator 6... let's see.

Ah... Test 6 has puzzles that do not have the "- Episode ?" part, while Validator 6 does.

Thanks for bringing it to my attention,
I'll fix it soon.

Hey @Cakeisalie5, I have fixed Test 6.

Hope that clears things up.

Reply back if not,
Code-Parser
Would Reverse be a good mode for this clash too? Or would it be too challenging?

Hello, @Code-Parser, thank you for your follow-up and feedback.

Cases
* Test/Validator 6, 7, 9 to 12: Please delete "Â®" in all input (12 cases in total).

Game modes
* I think Reverse mode is doable. You may enable it and see what others think.

Thanks again.

P.S. I'm honoured to be mentioned in one of the test cases again ðŸ˜‡.

Hello, @5DN1L... thanks for the reply.

I have fixed these issues and enabled Reverse.

Thanks,
 Code-Parser.

P.S No problem.
